docs.snippet: It took Len Carey of Fallbrook, Calif., exactly 10 minutes to name a German short-haired pointer, Ch. Gretchenhof Columbia River, best in show last night before a cheering crowd of 11,000 as the Westminster Kennel Club's 98th edition ended a two-d...
docs.lead_paragraph: It took Len Carey of Fallbrook, Calif., exactly 10 minutes to name a German short-haired pointer, Ch. Gretchenhof Columbia River, best in show last night before a cheering crowd of 11,000 as the Westminster Kennel Club's 98th edition ended a two-day run at Madison Square Garden. It was the first time that a representative of the breed had taken the top prize at the blue-ribbon event.
docs.abstract: article on Ch 4 Gretchenhof Columbia River, selected top dog at 98th annual Westminster Kennel Club dog show, Madison Square Garden, NYC; win is 1st for breed, German short-haired pointer; illus (L)

headline.main: German Pointer Is Best at Westminster Gretchenhof Columbia River; Gretchenhof Columbia River Picked From Entry of 3,146

docs.snippet: National Basketball Association players are hurting. Through yesterday, 43 players, 22 per cent of those in the league had missed a total of 550 games. The toll will grow higher, because some of the injured are sidelined for the season. Some of th...
docs.lead_paragraph: National Basketball Association players are hurting. Through yesterday, 43 players, 22 per cent of those in the league had missed a total of 550 games. The toll will grow higher, because some of the injured are sidelined for the season. Some of the biggest name players in the league have been struck down by injuries to knees, shoulders, elbows, ankles and hands.

headline.main: N.B.A.'s Mounting Casualty List Has the Leag ue Hurting All Over the said, "Some of us are; Casualties Mounting In N.B.A.

docs.lead_paragraph: A well-turned pair of ankles is certainly no handicap and there's obviously no need to fret if your shoulders are smooth and your bosom shapely. But what you really need in order to be in the forefront of fashion next summer is a smooth, flat midriff section.

docs.snippet: Leaders of the Christian Democrats, Chile's largest political party, say that their protest letter to the head of the ruling military junta was drafted only after senior members felt that their party's very existence was being threatened by the Go...
docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of the Christian Democrats, Chile's largest political party, say that their protest letter to the head of the ruling military junta was drafted only after senior members felt that their party's very existence was being threatened by the Government.
docs.abstract: Chilean leaders of Christian Dems say Jan 18 protest lr to Gen Augusto Pinochet Ugarte about violations of human rights, treatment of working class and attempts to suppress pol activity was drafted only after members felt party's existence was being threatened; hold lr was not intended to signal break with junta; oppose widespread killings; concede that party has been united by Govt decree banning any type of civilian pol activity; since Pres Allende's death, party has been divided into majority that sees no need for mil dictatorship and left-wing minority that opposes any cooperation with junta; party's meeting with Gen Oscar Bonilla indicates considerable unease among Christian Dems serving in Govt; Patricio Aylwin and Raul Saez comment on decree; Saez says regulation is Govt decree declaring pol parties in indefinite recess and prohibits parties from making pol statements; Aylwin explains problem to Bonilla that people are discontented (M)

headline.main: CHILE POLITICIANS FEAR FOR PARTY; Decrees Unite Party Decree 'a Monstrosity' The Problem Explained Christian Democrats See Threat in Junta's Actions

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELLSpecial to The New York Times
